uk.co.llblumire.coursework

Class Collider

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.co.llblumire.coursework.Collider
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Collider.BoxCollider, Collider.LineCollider, Collider.NoCollider

    public abstract class Collider
extends java.lang.Object
    Collider provides a number of different types of collider to check if arbitrary bounds are colliding. This class behaves as a closed union type and should be treated as externally private and therefore should NOT be subclassed. It does this by assigning each Collider a valency. Every Collider handles collision with all other colliders of lower valency.
    Author:
    L. L. Blumire

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Collider.BoxCollider
      Collides with anything that intersects it's bounding box.
      static class  Collider.CollisionStatus
      The status of a collision
      static class  Collider.LineCollider
      Collides with anything that intersects the line segment.
      static class  Collider.NoCollider
      Collides with nothing.

    • Method Detail

      • collidesWith

        public abstract Collider.CollisionStatus collidesWith(Collider c)
        The universal collider is special, and is assumed to be a special case. It should probably never be used.
        Parameters:
        c - The collider to check collision with.
        Returns:
        The result of a collision check.

      • valency

        public static final double valency(Collider c)
        The valency of a collider determines who handles computation of intersection. The highest valency collider always handles collision. Any unknown subclass will have Integer.MAX_VALUE valency and therefore will be expected to handle collision with all other possible types of collider.
        Parameters:
        c - the Collider to check the valency of.
        Returns:
        the valency of the collider.
